Am I the only one out here who thinks that defending family and home with
a=
ny means necessary against a burglar "inside" your own home is O.K.?=A0
=A0=

Bob,=A0 do you know if there was prejudice against the sword itself or wou=
ld
the home owner still have gone to jail if he stabbed the burglar with...=
lets
say a salad fork?
=A0
Here's a question for everyone out there in Niho=
nto land,=A0 can you briefly
tell me how your individual countries feel abo=
ut "swords" in general?=A0=A0 I
live in Canada and we have major restrictio=
ns when it comes to fire arms.=A0 I
will ask an RCMP friend of mine what wo=
uld happen to me if I defended myself
inside my home with my katana against=
 a burglar and I'll let you all know.
=A0
Mark
=A0

example=
, a gent was arrested, convicted and imprisoned for defending
himself in hi=
s own home using a sword against an unarmed burglar who had
broken into his=
 house. I don't know specifically if possession of a
bladed weapon is a pro=
blem, but any aggressive or defense use likely is
a problem.
